alert.note: Alert for Adams; Juneau; Monroe; Trempealeau (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 26 at 9:55PM CST until February 27 at 12:00PM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Freezing Rain, Snow Overnight Through Monday... .A potent, quick moving storm system will bring freezing rain and snow to the region overnight through the day Monday. Freezing rain spreads over and north of the Interstate 94 corridor overnight, starting to mix with and then change over to snow by mid to late Monday morning. Snow persists, mostly north of Highway 10 in north-central Wisconsin, through the afternoon with the storm exiting northeast in the evening. Icing up to one third of an inch is possible. With winds expected to gust 30 to 40 mph, areas that receive the heavier icing could experience tree damage and power outages. The bulk of the snow accumulations will be confined north of Highway 29 in north- central Wisconsin with a few inches possible. Temperatures will play a key role in icing amounts. Small changes could result in substantial shifts in impacts. Pay close attention to the forecast for any revisions. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM TO NOON CST MONDAY... * WHAT...Freezing rain expected. Total ice accumulations of around one tenth of an inch. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Trempealeau, Monroe, Juneau and Adams Counties. * WHEN...From 3 AM to noon CST Monday. * IMPACTS...Difficult travel conditions are possible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Prepare for possible power outages. Visit 511wi.gov for road conditions.
